verbs.description: invade (third-person singular simple present invades, present participle invading, simple past and past participle invaded)

examples: Under some circumstances police are allowed to invade a person's privacy.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To enter by force in order to conquer.
examples: Argentinian troops invaded the Falkland Islands in 1982.
The picnic was invaded by ants.

entries.meaning: To attack; to infringe; to encroach on; to violate.
examples: The king invaded the rights of the people.

entries.meaning: To make an unwelcome or uninvited visit or appearance, usually with an intent to cause trouble or some other unpleasant situation.
